  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Initialises all resources and classes:
      - MouseManager
      - KeyManager
      - GraphicsEngine
      - GameCore

      Then starts game loop by calling startGameLoop()

    • startGameLoop

      private void startGameLoop()
      Runs an infinite loop until the SHOULD_QUIT flag flagManager is true.

      Each loop, the code checks delta time to ensure the time between updates or frames is as constant as possible.

      If deltaUpdateTime is greater or equal to the timePerUpdate (derived by converting constant GameLoopConstants.UPS to milliseconds) the update() function is called.

      If deltaFrameTime is greater or equal to the timePerFrame (derived by converting constant GameLoopConstants.FPS to milliseconds) the render() function is called.

      When SHOULD_QUIT becomes true, the game loop will exit and call the quit() method.

    • update

      private static void update()
      Called by game loop inside startGameLoop()
      NOT TO BE CALLED BY ANY OTHER METHOD!

      Calls update() function in GameCore.

      Then calls update() function in GraphicsEngine.

    • render

      private static void render()
      Called by game loop inside startGameLoop()
      NOT TO BE CALLED BY ANY OTHER METHOD!

      Calls render() function in GameCore.

      Then calls render() function in GraphicsEngine.

    • requestQuit

      public static void requestQuit(QuitReason quitReason)
      Sets variable ##### to true, causing the game loop to stop looping.
      When the game loop exits it then calls the quit() method to destroy objects and save the game.

      Parameters:
      quitReason - The reason why the game should be quit (It is saved in the variable quitReason, and is printed out and recorded in log when method quit() is called by the termination of the game loop).

    • forceQuit

      public static void forceQuit(FatalTraceableException fatalCoreException)
      Directly calls all destroy() methods and attempts to save the game.
      SHOULD ONLY BE CALLED IN THE EVENT OF A FATAL ERROR!

      The program is then forcefully terminated without exiting the game loop with System.exit(1).

      Exits the program with a code of 1 to show that there was an error.

      Parameters:
      fatalCoreException - The #############################.

    • quit

      private static void quit()
      Called when game loop in startGameLoop() stops due to variable #### being true.
      NOT TO BE CALLED BY ANY OTHER METHOD!

      Destroys all objects and classes and attempts to save the game.

      The program is then terminated cleanly using System.exit(0).

      Exits the program with a code of 0 to show that it finished without errors.

    • destroyObjects

      private static int destroyObjects()
      Destroys the engine core's objects, ready for the program to be terminated or relaunched.
      Returns:
      Integer warnings - The number of warnings encountered when attempting to destroy objects.

    • close

      public void close()
